verses.verse: Dead <WH4194> flies <WH2070> cause the ointment <WH8081> of the apothecary <WH7543> <WH8802> to send forth <WH5042> <WH8686> a stinking savour <WH887> <WH8686>: so doth a little <WH4592> folly <WH5531> him that is in reputation <WH3368> for wisdom <WH2451> and honour <WH3519>.
A wise man's <WH2450> heart <WH3820> is at his right hand <WH3225>; but a fool's <WH3684> heart <WH3820> at his left <WH8040>.

Yea also, when he that is a fool <WH5530> walketh <WH1980> <WH8802> by the way <WH1870>, his wisdom <WH3820> faileth <WH2638> him, and he saith <WH559> <WH8804> to every one that he is a fool <WH5530>.

If the spirit <WH7307> of the ruler <WH4910> <WH8802> rise up <WH5927> <WH8799> against thee, leave <WH3240> <WH8686> not thy place <WH4725>; for yielding <WH4832> pacifieth <WH3240> <WH8686> great <WH1419> offences <WH2399>.
There is <WH3426> an evil <WH7451> which I have seen <WH7200> <WH8804> under the sun <WH8121>, as an error <WH7684> which proceedeth <WH3318> <WH8802> from <WH6440> the ruler <WH7989>:
Folly <WH5529> is set <WH5414> <WH8738> in great <WH7227> dignity <WH4791>, and the rich <WH6223> sit <WH3427> <WH8799> in low place <WH8216>.
I have seen <WH7200> <WH8804> servants <WH5650> upon horses <WH5483>, and princes <WH8269> walking <WH1980> <WH8802> as servants <WH5650> upon the earth <WH776>.
He that diggeth <WH2658> <WH8802> a pit <WH1475> shall fall <WH5307> <WH8799> into it; and whoso breaketh <WH6555> <WH8802> an hedge <WH1447>, a serpent <WH5175> shall bite <WH5391> <WH8799> him.
Whoso removeth <WH5265> <WH8688> stones <WH68> shall be hurt <WH6087> <WH8735> therewith; and he that cleaveth <WH1234> <WH8802> wood <WH6086> shall be endangered <WH5533> <WH8735> thereby.

If the iron <WH1270> be blunt <WH6949> <WH8765>, and he do not whet <WH7043> <WH8773> the edge <WH6440>, then must he put <WH1396> <WH8762> to more strength <WH2428>: but wisdom <WH2451> is profitable <WH3504> to direct <WH3787> <WH8687>.
Surely the serpent <WH5175> will bite <WH5391> <WH8799> without enchantment <WH3908>; and a babbler <WH3956> <WH1167> is no better <WH3504>.
The words <WH1697> of a wise man's <WH2450> mouth <WH6310> are gracious <WH2580>; but the lips <WH8193> of a fool <WH3684> will swallow up <WH1104> <WH8762> himself.
The beginning <WH8462> of the words <WH1697> of his mouth <WH6310> is foolishness <WH5531>: and the end <WH319> of his talk <WH6310> is mischievous <WH7451> madness <WH1948>.
A fool <WH5530> also is full <WH7235> <WH8686> of words <WH1697>: a man <WH120> cannot tell <WH3045> <WH8799> what shall be; and what shall be after <WH310> him, who can tell <WH5046> <WH8686> him?
The labour <WH5999> of the foolish <WH3684> wearieth <WH3021> <WH8762> every one of them, because he knoweth <WH3045> <WH8804> not how to go <WH3212> <WH8800> to the city <WH5892>.
Woe <WH337> to thee, O land <WH776>, when thy king <WH4428> is a child <WH5288>, and thy princes <WH8269> eat <WH398> <WH8799> in the morning <WH1242> !

Blessed <WH835> art thou, O land <WH776>, when thy king <WH4428> is the son <WH1121> of nobles <WH2715>, and thy princes <WH8269> eat <WH398> <WH8799> in due season <WH6256>, for strength <WH1369>, and not for drunkenness <WH8358> !
By much slothfulness <WH6103> the building <WH4746> decayeth <WH4355> <WH8735>; and through idleness <WH8220> of the hands <WH3027> the house <WH1004> droppeth through <WH1811> <WH8799>.
A feast <WH3899> is made <WH6213> <WH8802> for laughter <WH7814>, and wine <WH3196> maketh merry <WH8055> <WH8762> <WH2416>: but money <WH3701> answereth <WH6030> <WH8799> all things.

Curse <WH7043> <WH8762> not the king <WH4428>, no not in thy thought <WH4093>; and curse <WH7043> <WH8762> not the rich <WH6223> in thy bedchamber <WH2315> <WH4904>: for a bird <WH5775> of the air <WH8064> shall carry <WH3212> <WH8686> the voice <WH6963>, and that which hath <WH1167> wings <WH3671> shall tell <WH5046> <WH8686> the matter <WH1697>.
